children.subject:
As for my background, I am currently taking Linear Algebra (Math 54), but I don't have too much background in circuits.

For any instructors in the chat, please feel free to give some insight. Insider advice is always appreciated.

Thank You,

Ryota Inagaki
61B is fairly different from 61BL. So I think much of your decision would depend on which one you want to take.

I think practicality depends on your background in EE and CS in general. If you got a good score in 61A, then 61B shouldn't be a problem as it is more straightforward but it is still a lot work in terms of projects but you will have almost no problem picking up new material in data structures. It is still a large leap in my opinion as projects become super large and no more hand-holding (nothing drastic or too big you can't handle in my opinion) 

If you have 0 knowledge in linear algebra and a shaky background in circuits, I feel that 16A will eat up more time for you than 61B. A lot of my friends who are super strong in CS (A in 61A/B/C/70/170) completely struggle in EE16A/B in general because of amount of work (8~10 hrs of homework weekly and could be more if you're super shaky), super hard midterms, and just the feel is SUPER different from a CS class in general. 

Also keep in mind summer is twice the pace, so go at your own risk. 8 units would be equivalent to 16 units normal pace in a semester. You can start off by taking 2 of the classes and then dropping one later. Or just take one and enjoy your summer and focus on the material as well.

Personally, I would take 16A because I would wait for Hug (amazing teacher) to teach 61B in Fall2020.

history.content:
Dear EECS/Cs Advising,

Do you think that taking CS 61BL and EECS 16A over this summer would be practical? I am considering declaring EECS sometime within the next year.

Thank You,

Ryota Inagaki
history.subject: Summer Plans
